newsitem.title: USA: Unions at Digital seek operations overhaul.
newsitem.headline: Unions at Digital seek operations overhaul.

text.p: Digital Equipment Corp's unions are seeking a change in the company's strategy and an overhaul of management, which includes splitting the chairman and chief executive officer's position.

IG Metall, European Works Councils representatives, and the Communications Workers of America are calling for greater investments in marketing and services operations and a restructuring of management to reflect those investments.
The unions and work councils from France, Germany and other European countries represent 20,000 Digital employees, the unions said in a statement.
Digital Equipment was not immediately available for comment.

The unions and work councils said they are calling for changes that will enhance the long-term value for shareholders while preserving employment and opposing those proposals seeking to break-up the company.
Regarding the investments in marketing and services, the unions said they want use some of the $2 billion in cash reserves toward this plan.
The unions contend that Digital has been pursuing an agenda of "neglecting and divesting" anything not related to hardware technology.
